  • Full-Time IMC Master's Program
  • Specializations

Full-Time Integrated Marketing Communication Master’s Program

IMC students develop a deep understanding of consumers and build communications strategies based on qualitative insights and quantitative analysis.

About the Program

Students participate in many hands-on experiences both in and out of the classroom. The program features a strong focus on media, particularly the digital media technologies that are revolutionizing the ways organizations interact with consumers and other audiences.

Image Caption Heading

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Facere placeat amet omnis odio quis voluptas ullam ex quod, dignissimos saepe.

Why the Full-Time IMC Program?

The full-time Integrated Marketing Communication (IMC) program is designed to launch your career in the marketing field through an intensive, five-quarter program that prepares you to solve the marketing problems of the digital age.

Students typically have a few years of work experience or come directly from undergraduate programs. The program is internationally focused with approximately half of the students coming from outside the U.S.

What Will I Study?

The full-time program requires students to complete 15 courses and a summer immersion quarter. The immersion quarter combines classroom learning with on-site immersion with top companies to work on real-world consulting projects. Students can choose electives from among the five specializations to customize their experiences to match career goals and interests.

Specializations Include:

Specialization
  • Digital and Interactive Marketing
  • Strategic Communications
  • Brand Strategy
Specialization
  • Marketing Analytics
  • Content Marketing
  • Media Management

Learning Outcomes

In this program, you will learn to create innovative marketing communications strategies by working collaboratively with global companies to solve current marketing communications challenges. In the master’s program at Medill, you will:

  • Develop insights that engage consumers to grow businesses.
  • Integrate brand communications across digital and traditional media platforms.
  • Analyze complex data to inform powerful brand communication strategies.
  • Produce social media campaigns that drive measurable results.

Featured Student Work

Student Work Added to U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum Collection

A summer reporting project that sent Medill graduate journalism students to Germany and throughout Chicago to record personal stories has been added to the collection of the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington, D.C. The Memory Archives project was created through a collaboration between students from Medill and HAW Hamburg School of Design, Media and Arts in the summer of 2014. The students tracked dozens of Holocaust survivors and their family members in Chicago and Hamburg, Germany, and recorded their testimonials in text, video and audio.

Alumni

J.A. Adande
2008 alum, IMC

J.A. Adande has been giving Los Angeles Times readers his view of the sports world for six years, introducing them to everyone from Shaquille O’Neal to the man who operates the centerfield geyser at Edison Field. Other assignments have included the Olympic Games, Wimbledon, the Super Bowl, the NCAA Final Four, and the NBA Finals.

Related Programs

IMC Undergraduate Certificate

The five-course certificate program features core courses in consumer insight, research and IMC strategy as well as a variety of electives that enable Northwestern undergraduates to enhance their majors with a specialization in IMC.
